editorialSummary.text: Functional rooms in an unpretentious hotel with a casual eatery, a bar & a tree-shaded lawn.

text.text:
The rooms were spacious and the maintenance was good. The staff was very helpful.
We had only 2 issues: the food was average, and the AC was quite noisy.
I'd still recommend this place, but suggest against having breakfast here.

originalText.text:
The rooms were spacious and the maintenance was good. The staff was very helpful.
We had only 2 issues: the food was average, and the AC was quite noisy.
I'd still recommend this place, but suggest against having breakfast here.

text.text: This is a government run hotel located right on the main road. Rooms are large. The deluxe rooms are provided with an electric kettle. The AC worked well and there was running hot and cold water in the attached bathroom. Car parking is outside the hotel, but  under CCTV surveillance. There is a restaurant with reasonable variety of dishes and a beer bar. Food at the restaurant is OK but not great. Service is quick. The staff are polite and helpful. There are a lot of monkeys; it is sensible to keep the door locked. Overall, a good place to stay in Badami

There are a lot of monkeys; it is sensible to keep the door locked. Overall, a good place to stay in Badami

text.text:
Absolutely fantastic experience here while staying here for 1 night during my recent solo motorcycle ride to Karnataka.

I had booked this property directly through the Karnataka Tourism website. And it was a seamless experience without any glitches.

The property is quite dated and it shows. But at the same time, it is excellently maintained by the staff of professionals.

The room alloted to me was spacious, clean, comfortable and adequate for a solo rider like me.

The in-house restaurant was fantastic and I thoroughly enjoyed the evening coffee, morning breakfast and the dinner I had.

The location is super convenient. The market is at a walking distance and the Badami Caves are quite close too.

The parking space provided inside the property was super helpful as well.

100% recommended for anyone looking for a comfortable and friendly stay in Badami.

text.text:
Set in lovely gardens with monkeys, a range of birds and bats. Itâ€™s in an excellent location for Badamiâ€™s amazing historical temples 20 mins walk. Rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable but non AC is really hot, itâ€™s worth upgrading to AC,especially this time of year.  They have hot water all the time too The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful especially in the restaurant area, the food was good and they have many options, just check what is available.

1.5 km from the bus station
5 km from train station (nothing around there anyway)

Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel if you are in n Badami.

text.text:
An amazing stay, good for family or friends.
Hotel has an old school charm, similar to what you can expect from any Govt. establishment.
Food was good, bathrooms were clean.
We stayed in the Dome room, which was an unique experience altogether.
Would love to visit again.

text.text:
Beautiful resort with a lot of potential.
This place is hard to reach and has nothing in the vicinity. It's 6km away from the city. We stayed here in beginning of April and it was deserted. There was barely anyone in the premises.
Our allocated room was big, had a cupboard, a coffee table with 2 chairs, a big comfy bed and nice veranda. Our room had A/c which was very handy during the heat wave.
The pool was pleasant. Apart from swimming pool there's shuttle badminton and indoor games.
They have in-house dining option which we tried the first evening and decided not to return. The placemats at the table were unclean. The salt and pepper shakers had splashes of sauces on the outside. And the food was below average.
Breakfast was a-la carte was very average.
The surroundings are beautiful and green. Very peaceful.

text.text: Wonderful place with reasonable prices. Rooms are really spacious and clean. Well behaved staff with polite behaviour. Food is really good. Do opt for buffet and pay before hand. The only negative is there are No games for little kids like swings or slides, but i heard that they getting them installed soon.

The only negative is there are No games for little kids like swings or slides, but i heard that they getting them installed soon.

text.text: one of the worst hotels we have stayed in the recent years. They claim many stars for this resort, however they don't understand what basic hygiene means. It is a 2 year old resort and it looks like 10 year old one due to poor maintenance. Flushes don't work, gets clogged in front of the room, TV channels don't work due to subscription expiry, windows don't close etc. Restaurant serves very few items with exorbitant prices.

It is a 2 year old resort and it looks like 10 year old one due to poor maintenance. Flushes don't work, gets clogged in front of the room, TV channels don't work due to subscription expiry, windows don't close etc. Restaurant serves very few items with exorbitant prices.

text.text:
Morpho Banasree resort in Badami fail to offer a satisfactory experience during our stay. Claiming to be a four star resort, they cannot maintain basic standards of hygiene and cleanliness. As soon as we arrived at the resort, we were greeted with a huge stink  coming from the room and the bathroom. The vanity mirror was missing too. I am surprised to see that despite the good reviews, they did not offer us a good experience in the stay. They did not even offer us a refund, claiming that we had to check in before, but that day we were the first ones to check in. They also failed to do a simple job such as moving our luggage into the room which is truly disappointing and disheartening from the consumers aspect. This is definitely a ripoff for Rs.20,000 and advise nobody else to stay in this resort.

Update: They offered us another room in which the Geyser wasn't working, which we had replaced after another 30 minutes of argument. The next day the geyser stopped working and we were asked to use the adjacent room for our showers and baths.
Before checking out they only offered us a 300Rs discount which is unfair beyond doubt. Was truly a headache staying in this resort. They called me to remove this review too.

Would advise not to book.

editorialSummary.text: Understated rooms & suites in a low-key hotel offering a low-key restaurant & a bar.

text.text:
We booked a Premium Room which was on the 4th Floor.

The positive thing about Clarks Hotel is the location, in the center of the City a lot of the sites are within walking distance.
But being in the City Center the noise of traffic in the front, road facing rooms is very loud.  We requested a room at the back of the hotel which was fine until there was this loud roaring noise that started at 6:30pm when we enquired what it was, we were told it is the kitchen exhaust.  This got switched off only at 10:00pm. Therefore when the kitchen is working the exhaust gets switched on so the rooms to the back too are very noisy as well

Numbers given on the web site as well as the Booking Confirmation email are not functional. I wanted to inform the Hotel that we would be checking in late but could not contact the Hotel.

Rooms are in a pretty run down condition, no fridge no toilet paper, no amenities on day one, day two we were provided with minimal amenities.

The common toilet off the Dinning Room is in a terrible state of disrepair.

A very elaborate Menu card is placed in the rooms, when we  tried to place our order, everything we asked for (vegetarian) was not available.  Finally we said tell us what you can give us, we were informed that only North Indian food, limited menu could be served.  The breakfast, mostly South Indian was adequate.

The Staff at Clarks Inn Badami are the only saving point,  thought we could see they were understaffed, they were very helpful, courteous and polite.

Overall impression was not good, I personally would not recommend it to friends or family.

text.text:
Located at Badami town main circle, 10 mins walk to Badami caves.
Rooms clean and big.
Service needs improvement.
Have a long food menu, but serves only Indian cuisine. Ordered Veg tikka, but got burnt tikkas twice, finally had to cancel order.
Overall good stay, although a bit pricey.

originalText.text:
Located at Badami town main circle, 10 mins walk to Badami caves.
Rooms clean and big.
Service needs improvement.
Have a long food menu, but serves only Indian cuisine. Ordered Veg tikka, but got burnt tikkas twice, finally had to cancel order.
Overall good stay, although a bit pricey.

text.text:
Supposedly a 3 star hotel, but in fact it is a third class hotel. We booked this hotel because of good experience at Clark's Hampi. But we were very disappointed  with Clark's Badami.
The linen and towels were filthy, torn and yellow. We asked for a replacement but found them similarly sub standard. The bathroom fittings were old,  rusted, leaking, dysfunctional. The toiletries and tea bags were of lowest quality. They could not be used, so we bought our own from Badami market.
Overall we were left with a feeling of being in an unhygienic, dirty environment. The restaurant had very few options, and breakfast was stale. It made us sick.
Except for the location, I would not recommend this hotel.
The wi-fi did not connect.

editorialSummary.text: Simple quarters in a laid-back hotel offering a vegetarian restaurant & free breakfast.

text.text: It was an amazing experience , great to spend time with friends and family, food is good, little bit clean needs to be done mainly in the washroom. Because of the bad smell a lot of mosquitoes are there so it has to be taken care of rest everything is good.

text.text:
Great hotel in Badami close to the caves.
We were greeted warmly, the accommodation was large and comfortable. A bit rustic but expected.
They have some lovely cottages but we had a deluxe room with AC
The breakfast was a bit too limited but dinner and lunch was very good and tasty.
We had a good stay here and would recommend.

text.text:
Noteworthy thing about this resort is the STAFF. Very much polite and humble ready to serve with the best attitude.
Rooms are spacious and well equipped with all amenities.
Food veg/non-veg is simply delicious. Quantity and quality.
They gave us best price as we booked directly by calling the hotel.

text.text: Great experience.  The rooms are near and tidy and spacious.  There is no pool. The restaurant menu is good. Very polite staff. Highly recommended. We updated our room to cottage.  The shifting was easy.

editorialSummary.text: Straightforward rooms in an unpretentious hotel offering a restaurant/bar & a 24-hour cafe.

text.text:
The hotel is old but for the price point, it is very well placed. Good for a short stay.

Staff was helpful and accommodating. Normally it gets filled on weekends and long holidays because a lot of groups from colleges and schools visit the sites.

It's next to the bus stand so if you are using public transport, the location is the best.

originalText.text:
The hotel is old but for the price point, it is very well placed. Good for a short stay.

Staff was helpful and accommodating. Normally it gets filled on weekends and long holidays because a lot of groups from colleges and schools visit the sites.

It's next to the bus stand so if you are using public transport, the location is the best.

text.text: This hotel is located exactly in front of the Badami bus stand, which will make your commute very convenient. The room was clean and equipped with basic amenities. The staff was very helpful. When we talked with them, they helped us with the bus timings, points we must visit, and places where we can have local food. We covered all points by walking from this hotel.

originalText.text: This hotel is located exactly in front of the Badami bus stand, which will make your commute very convenient. The room was clean and equipped with basic amenities. The staff was very helpful. When we talked with them, they helped us with the bus timings, points we must visit, and places where we can have local food. We covered all points by walking from this hotel.

text.text:
Stayed for three days. It's right opp to bus stand which is a good thing as well as bad, it's always noisy right from 5 AM till 10 PM. Parking is behind the building which goes through a narrow road. Walk from room to parking is not advisable if women are along as it goes through a bar which is always occupied. Rooms are average and lot of scope of improvement.

Recommend to leave 4 wheeler here if visiting badami historical places and use public transport, roads to these places are super narrow and parking is a nightmare.

text.text:
PROS:
1. Close to the bus stop.
2. Hot water availability.

CONS:
1. Very old building and rooms
2. Didnâ€™t even  change the bed spread. There was hair and flowers still on the bed. Requested to change the bed spread but they didnâ€™t do it.
3. Suspecting bed bugs in the room.
4. Parking is an issue. Though there is parking behind the hotel, passing through the narrow streets was not easy.

text.text:
One of the best hotels if you need convenience and comfort at one place. It is right opposite to badami bus stand. All major sightseeing places are at walkable distance. For auto hotel itself arrange it otherwise ample autos available at bus stand.for food one famous restaurant is in the same premises. Others also very nearby and all are open early morning.

Rooms are specious, clean and with all gadgets in working condition. 24 hours hot water available which is like a rare thing.

All the staff is very nice and cooperative

Overall best hotel to stay in Badami

displayName.text: HOTEL BADAMI COURT(unit of Shreejit Resorts Pvt Ltd)

editorialSummary.text: Colourful hotel offering an outdoor pool & a sundeck with a coffee shop, as well as casual dining.

text.text: An excellent place for staying, all sight seeing places are at close proximity. Friendly staff though they have a restaurant which serves vegetarian and non-vegetarian food we preferred going to their pure veg restaurant Pakwan situated about 7 minutes drive from the hotel. Overall a very good stay with comfort.

originalText.text: An excellent place for staying, all sight seeing places are at close proximity. Friendly staff though they have a restaurant which serves vegetarian and non-vegetarian food we preferred going to their pure veg restaurant Pakwan situated about 7 minutes drive from the hotel. Overall a very good stay with comfort.

text.text: Went by looks and hoped for a good experience, Visited for lunch on 27. The restaurant was fully occupied and there were some people already waiting. On enquiry we were asked to wait. One table was billed and they vacated, waiter asked a few mins to clean the table. Even after 20 mins they purposefully didn't clean the table and kept us waiting and the restaurant manager was abusing when enquired why the delay. It was over 40 mins thanks to their arrogance, it was very much intentional. We were a family with 2 kids. Front desk manager was a useless fellow simply stating at our face with all this drama happening. It felt more like a harassment towards tourists. This place is not recommended for anyone given the arrogant and third class behavior from their hopeless staff.

editorialSummary.text: Laid-back accommodations with minifridges, plus breakfast, parking & 24/7 room service.

text.text: I recently stayed at a resort that exceeded my expectations. The spacious and impeccably clean rooms created a comfortable atmosphere. The ambiance was delightful, providing a relaxing environment. The staff's exceptional service and politeness added to the positive experience, and the food served was of high quality. While the gated parking was a plus, improving the open area could enhance the overall experience. Nevertheless, it's undeniably a fantastic place to stay.

While the gated parking was a plus, improving the open area could enhance the overall experience. Nevertheless, it's undeniably a fantastic place to stay.

text.text:
The place is absolutely beautifully kept. The rooms are huge and quite clean. The rent for such a room is quite reasonable. As soon as you enter the place you are greeted by playful rabbits (which are kept by the owner of the place) which definitely changes your mood.

I would just suggest some quick service for their restaurants. Overall great thumbs up to this place and its owner & staff who maintained the place exceptionally well.

originalText.text:

text.text:
Krishna Heritage Hotel stands out as one of the best value-for-money accommodations in Badami, Karnataka. Recently visited there for a short visit.
It is situated conveniently near the main market, it offers easy access to local attractions.

The resort's charm lies in its picturesque green surroundings, complete with rabbits, swings, lotus ponds and a swimming pool, although during my visit, the pool was unfortunately not operational.

The rooms are very spacious. Each room has separate entrance looby and individual amenities like dressing rooms and open to sky showers. Each room feels like a mini-suite, providing ample comfort and privacy.

The dining area reflects a rustic charm with tables and chairs crafted from real tree trunks, adding to the hotel's unique ambiance. However, while the food served is decent, offering a variety of cuisines including Punjabi and Chinese, it lacks any outstanding flavor or signature dishes.

Overall, Krishna Heritage Hotel offers excellent value for money, with its spacious accommodations and convenient location setting it one of the best options in Badami.

text.text: Amazing place ... Huge rooms, balcony  and a ridiculously large bathroom ... Can't praise this place enough. The hotel also has pet rabbits which were the highlight for my kid. The food is amazing , we had all meals here for breakfast, lunch as well as dinner. Staff is super friendly. Wifi is available only in the reception area. Best place if you are going to be exploring badami, aihole area

text.text: Rooms are very nice,but the manager is a cheater. Check in time is 12 o clock,we reached early and check in at 8:30,I informed that time that next day we will check out at 10:00.That time manager did not not informed that I have to pay one days extra charge if we check out after one hour.next day morning also he did not inform me that your time is over. Half an hour before checkin he asked for half day charge,I agree and tell that will leave room after 3 o clock,then he tell that you have to pay full day charge.

text.text:
Incident when I went in March 2023- My experience was not good, I went to Badami with my family, I went to see the room alone and I fixed the room and also decided the rate, after a while I went to check in with my family, then The man at the counter was different and the man was sitting drunk, he started demanding more than the agreed amount. I paid more because I had no choice,
You can see the condition of the room.

text.text:
Beware of bedbugs here.

It's a over priced stay in Badami. They charge â‚¹1500 for each room which is very expensive for this kind of room and service.

Rooms are very small and toilets are not so in good condition. If you don't have any other choice, stay here.

Power goes sometimes without backup for few minutes. Hot water they said it will be available till 10 AM while we check-in but morning they said take bath quickly it will be stopped at 9 AM.

Don't reach this hotel in the late night, they will be in the deep sleep and not so easy to make them awake or get a stay here.

text.text: The staff and the owner is very supportive.It is in very convenient location and affordable rates. Rooms were well maintained.

originalText.text: The staff and the owner is very supportive.It is in very convenient location and affordable rates. Rooms were well maintained.

text.text: Great value for price. "Deluxe" is not the word I'd choose to describe it, but it's comfortable and sufficient. The location is awesome, major sites all in walking distance. I was particularly impressed with the staff. The site through which I had booked the hotel had failed to forward my booking and the booked room was not available on the first night, but the staff was kind enough to give me different (bigger) room for one night with no added charges. Also extremely helpful in general with tips & arrangements.

originalText.text: Great value for price. "Deluxe" is not the word I'd choose to describe it, but it's comfortable and sufficient. The location is awesome, major sites all in walking distance. I was particularly impressed with the staff. The site through which I had booked the hotel had failed to forward my booking and the booked room was not available on the first night, but the staff was kind enough to give me different (bigger) room for one night with no added charges. Also extremely helpful in general with tips & arrangements.

text.text: Excellent hotel for budget travellers, right across from the bus station. Nice garden bar nearby.

originalText.text: Excellent hotel for budget travellers, right across from the bus station. Nice garden bar nearby.

text.text:
I stayed only for one night. My booking was originally at some other hotel but i had to stay here for one night due to some issue with the booking. I was sceptical at first but the Manager/Owner was very helpful. He made sure I was comfortable and also arranged for a cab for sightseeing. Rooms are slightly old and a little rough around the edges. But they are passably clean. The hotel is located right opposite the bus stand. So it is very convenient but also quite noisy (although I did not face much of an issue). Do not expect 5 star service but f you want a reasonay comfortable stay for a couple of nights this will do the job.

The hotel has a bar but does not serve meals. Veg snacks are fine but nonveg is not.

text.text:
The good part about this hotel is that location, which is hardly 10 minutes away from the Badami cave temples. The rooms were clean and we had a comfortable stay of two days. They should start the food service as well, we had to go out for the food.
Also, the staff need to talk in Hindi or English, as a tourist nobody will learn Kannada.
